text: Access to health care is vital, because I mean,
these are the things
which will allow us to live a full life.
Life is priceless.
Once it’s lost it’s lost.
Traditionally, we think of becoming a doctor,
or being a nurse,
but there’s so many other ways
where we can create an impact.
And we’re able to do so using
drones, and AWS technology.
It’s such a beautiful machine.
- I remember, when I saw it for the first time,
I saw it in the sky.
That thing, that’s not a bird.
- In Malawi, we use drones to deliver
medical supplies, such as vaccines,
to three and a half million people.
- Easily on a normal day,
we can get up to 30 to 40 flights.
We just got a call

that polio vaccines need to be 
delivered at once.

Right now, there’s been 
a little outbreak going on.
This place is usually hot,

and the samples may go bad
 because of the temperature.

So we have cold chain boxes
to keep content inside cold.
And then we load
the cargo onto the aircraft.
- The drone will hover up,
and then it switches to flying like a plane.
The challenge, from a technical perspective,
is flying where the pilot
is not able to see the aircraft
flying beyond line of sight.

How we’ve done this, 
is the aircraft connect

via both cellular networks, 
and satellite networks,
up to AWS as an IoT thing,
which gives us that ability
to fly out long distances
to regional and remote areas.
- In Malawi, getting to the hospital
to get medication
can be a very difficult journey.
We have some fuel shortages.
Or the ambulances are completely broken down.
Flooding, bridges broken.
It can easily be a 12 hour trip.
But with our drone,
we’re able to cut the time down to 45 minutes.
- When my sister gave birth,
she lost a lot of blood.

- Nsanje district hospital 
didn’t have her blood type.
The neighboring district did.
But, it’s a 4 hour trip.
- It was life-threatening. So, we used the drone.
- From getting aircrafts ready to fly,
to actually delivering,
we did that in the space of an hour.
- After receiving the blood donation,
she was assisted and cared for.

- That’s a direct example 
of actually saving a life.
- What we’ve done so far is quickly growing.

We want to continue 
expanding around the world
but how do we actually make
this efficient, in all these remote areas?
One of the real advantages in using AWS,
is the scalability.

They’ve got all that 
mix of services, easily on hand,

giving pilots access 
to low latency connection.

This provides that 
really fast response time,

and reliable communications 
to the drone.
- I’m real thankful for these drones,
they’re a real help in our community.
Because time is very important.
- It really helps.
because they get what they're
supposed to get at the time.
At a point of time, I saved a life.
So, it’s something amazing.
- It really changes your perspective.
I’m just now a little more conscious about
what it really means to be human.
It’s important to bridge the gap
between the need of health care,
and actually providing access to it.
It’s just amazing to be a part of helping
make a better tomorrow.
